scenario_text.value: Now, let’s open the gate to the interior.
Wow! The wall’s moving!

Looks like the mechanisms are a little rusty.
Huh? I think I see a mural inside?
This, this is...!!!
What is it, Professor?

It’s in ancient Yayoi style...and First-style
Pompeian, and that of the Gupta Empire. How?
The Gupta what now?

Never mind that, look! This is simply
incredible!
Uh, Professor? I’m afraid you’ve lost us.

Right, yes, allow me to explain. This is what
is written here.

Our world and this other world were created
separately long ago.
But that’s not all!

Humans and monsters were once one. Two pieces
of the same soul. That’s what it says.
Huh? So does that make us the same as humans?

It’s true, I do feel an odd sense of comfort
when I am with Kaito, but I don’t know.

(I get it now. That’s why when something goes
wrong here, it has an effect in our world.)

Labramon, that means we’re connected by
a bond...no, something even more powerful...
You’re right, Aoi!

And if that’s true, the key to saving Miyuki
really does lie in Renamon and the Professor.
In myself...and Renamon?

Yeah. Remember how when you called her, she
came back to her senses for a second?
That should work in this next fight too.
Yes... You’re right.

Yeah! So first we pin down Miyuki, and then
the Professor and Renamon call out to her.
Right! That settles it!

But...what happens if things don’t go so
well?

If that happens... We’ll grab Miyuki and
hightail it out of there...
